0P00000BVC.F.long_name: Mediolanum Challenge Italian Equity Fund L Acc
0P00000BVC.F.summary: The investment objective of Challenge Italian Equity Fund is long term capital appreciation through investment in a diversified portfolio of leading Italian stocks listed or traded on Recognised Exchanges. The performance of the Sub-FundÂ´s portfolio of investments will be measured against the MSCI (Morgan Stanley Capital International) Italy Index (or any other index which replaces it or is considered to be the market standard in place of that index and any such change in that index will be notified to Unitholders in the semi-annual and annual accounts), a market capitalisation weighted index of the leading Italian companies. Currently (31/8/2000) the MSCI Italy Index contains approximately 44 companies. The Sub-Fund will be managed to perform closely in line with that Index.

0P00000TS3.F.summary: Investimento principale in strumenti finanziari rappresentativi del capitale di rischio. Investimento residuale in OICR. Gli investimenti sono denominati principalmente in Euro.

0P00000TTF.F.summary:

0P00000U0C.F.summary: Tipologia di strumenti finanziari e valuta di denominazione: principalmente di natura azionaria denominati in euro.
0P00000U0C.F.manager_bio: Responsabile fondi azionari di Banco Napoli AM Sgr (1999-2001).Gestore del fondo BN Azioni Italia (1992-1999).Analista finanziario sul mercato primario e secondario presso la Divisione generale del Banco di Napoli (1989-1992).Auditor presso Arthur Andersen (1987-1988).

0P00000U61.F.summary: Investimento principale in strumenti di natura azionaria denominati in euro.

ATMMIF.MI.short_name: ATOMO MADE IN ITALY FUND - CLAS
ATMMIF.MI.long_name: ATOMO - Made in Italy Fund L EUR Acc
ATMMIF.MI.summary: The Sub-Fund is dedicated to the Italian market and more specifically to investors willing to invest in the Italian stock exchange Borsa Italiana S.p.A.. The objective of the Sub-Fund is to seek long-term capital growth by investing in Italian Equities with a focus on Small Cap Stocks (market capitalization under 1 billion). To achieve its investment objective, the Sub-Fund will mainly invest in: â¢ Equities, equity-linked instruments and in convertible bonds; The sub-Fund may also invest in â¢ Bonds, including fixed or floating rates, zero-coupons, government, treasury or corporate bonds without limits of duration or grade and Bonds related products â¢ Money Market Instruments.
